remarks: Lemma for ~ plydivalg .  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 24-Jul-2014.)
statement:
plydiv.pl $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. S /\ y e. S ) ) -> ( x + y ) e. S ) $.
plydiv.tm $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. S /\ y e. S ) ) -> ( x x. y ) e. S ) $.
plydiv.rc $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. S /\ x =/= 0 ) ) -> ( 1 / x ) e. S ) $.
plydiv.m1 $e |- ( ph -> -u 1 e. S ) $.
plydiv.f $e |- ( ph -> F e. ( Poly ` S ) ) $.
plydiv.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. ( Poly ` S ) ) $.
plydiv.z $e |- ( ph -> G =/= 0p ) $.
plydiv.r $e |- R = ( F oF - ( G oF x. q ) ) $.
plydiveu.q $e |- ( ph -> q e. ( Poly ` S ) ) $.
plydiveu.qd $e |- ( ph -> ( R = 0p \/ ( deg ` R ) < ( deg ` G ) ) ) $.
plydiveu.t $e |- T = ( F oF - ( G oF x. p ) ) $.
plydiveu.p $e |- ( ph -> p e. ( Poly ` S ) ) $.
plydiveu.pd $e |- ( ph -> ( T = 0p \/ ( deg ` T ) < ( deg ` G ) ) ) $.
plydiveu $p |- ( ph -> p = q ) $.
$d F p q x y $.
$d G p q x y $.
$d R p x y $.
$d S p q x y $.
$d T x y $.
$d p q x y $.
$d p q x y $.
$d ph x y $.
$d x y $.
$d x y $.
$d x y $.
